identificationModule.briefTitle: Changes in FeNO Value During Pulmonary Rehabilitation in Patients with Asthma
identificationModule.officialTitle: Change in Daily FeNO During Three Weeks of Inpatient Pulmonary Rehabilitation in Patients with Asthma

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study investigates the use of fractional exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO) measurement to monitor non-pharmacological therapy during a three-week inpatient rehabilitation programme for asthma patients. It compares FeNO levels (measured three times a day) with clinical parameters and quality of life to analyse daily fluctuations and the acute effect of exercise training on FeNO levels. As FeNO is a non-invasive biomarker of airway inflammation, this study aims to expand its role in therapy monitoring and explore its application in a rehabilitation setting.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Fractional Exhaled Nitric Oxide (FeNO) at rest
primaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of FeNo will be done with the Vivatmo Me device (by Bosch Health Care Solutions GmbH)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From enrollment to the end of rehabilitation at 3 weeks. Daily measurements at 9AM; 1PM; 5PM

primaryOutcomes.measure: Fractional Exhaled Nitric Oxide (FeNO) before/after exercise
primaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of FeNo will be done with the Vivatmo Me device (by Bosch Health Care Solutions GmbH)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From enrollment to the end of rehabilitation at 3 weeks, FeNO measurements will be done before and after a bicycle endurance training

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

secondaryOutcomes.description: Forced expiratory flow in 1 second, will be measured by Bodyplethysmography
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

secondaryOutcomes.description: Eosinophils will be collected by venous blood sample. Unit: total number of cells per ul blood and percentage
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

secondaryOutcomes.description: C-reactive protein will be collected by venous blood sample. Unit: mg/liter
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

secondaryOutcomes.description: Immunoglobulin E will be collected by venous blood sample. Unit: ug/liter
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

secondaryOutcomes.description: This test will be performed according to the described standard of the American Thoracic Society and the European Respiratory Society 2014
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On admission and discharge from the 3-week rehabilitation programme

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* confirmed diagnosis of bronchial asthma (all disease severities)
* Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) with an asthma component, where the asthma component plays a clinically relevant role
* written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) as the primary disease
* unability to perform FeNO measurement independently
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients will be recruitet at the pulmonary rehabilitation center at the Schön Klinik Berchtesgadener Land in Schönau am Königssee, Germany

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: The data will be made available upon personal request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: The data will be made available upon personal request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: The data will be made available upon personal request submitting a proposal that describes planned analyses.
